com.dsi.ant.channel

Class AntChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dsi.ant.channel.AntChannel

  • public final class AntChannel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single channel on any piece of ANT hardware. It is the communication link used to establish a wireless connection.

    This class is parcelable and can therefore be passed between processes. In this case care must be taken that setMessageHandler(IAntChannelMessageHandler) and clearMessageHandler() are used properly. Also note that all copies of this object can make calls into the ANT Radio Service, so who is making calls must be properly co-ordinated or changes to the channel state from other processes must be accounted for.

    • Method Detail

      • unassign

        public void unassign()
              throws RemoteException,
                     AntCommandFailedException
        Unassigns this channel. A channel must be unassigned before it can be reassigned using assign(ChannelType). When a channel is unassigned you should assume any channel configuration previously performed on this channel has been lost.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • assign

        public void assign(ChannelType channelType)
            throws RemoteException,
                   AntCommandFailedException
        Assigns this channel, specifying its type. A channel must be unassigned before it can be reassigned using #unassign(ChannelType).

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        channelType - Specify that this channel should be either a master or slave, and a shared channel or not.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • assign

        public void assign(ChannelType channelType,
          ExtendedAssignment extendedAssignment)
            throws RemoteException,
                   AntCommandFailedException
        Assigns this channel, specifying its type and optional extended parameters. A channel must be unassigned before it can be reassigned using #unassign(ChannelType).

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        channelType - Specify that this channel should be either a master or slave, and a shared channel or not.
        extendedAssignment - Indicates optional features to be enabled.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • setChannelId

        public void setChannelId(ChannelId channelId)
                  throws RemoteException,
                         AntCommandFailedException
        Configures the channel ID for this channel. Note: When a channel is searching, a value of 0 here signifies using a wild card for that parameter when finding a match.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        channelId - The device number, device type and transmission type to identify this channel.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • setPeriod

        public void setPeriod(int period_32768unitsPerSecond)
               throws RemoteException,
                      AntCommandFailedException
        Configures the messaging period of this channel.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        period_32768unitsPerSecond - The message period to use for this channel, in 1/32768ths of a second units. Valid range is 0-65535.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • setRfFrequency

        public void setRfFrequency(int radioFrequencyOffset)
                    throws RemoteException,
                           AntCommandFailedException
        Sets the RF frequency for this channel. See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.
        Parameters:
        radioFrequencyOffset - The radio frequency to use for this channel's communication as an offset in MHz from 2400MHz (2.4GHz). Valid range is 0-124MHz. For maximum compatibility it should be in the range of 2-80MHz.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • addIdToInclusionExclusionList

        public void addIdToInclusionExclusionList(ChannelId channelId,
                                 int listIndex)
                                   throws RemoteException,
                                          AntCommandFailedException
        Adds channel IDs to the inclusion/exclusion list for this channel. Note: the search filtering is not enabled until configureInclusionExclusionList(int, boolean) is called.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        channelId - The device number, device type and transmission type to identify this channel.
        listIndex - The (0-based) index to place the ID at in the list. Valid range is 0-3. Always overwrites any existing value.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • configureInclusionExclusionList

        public void configureInclusionExclusionList(int listSize,
                                   boolean exclude)
                                     throws RemoteException,
                                            AntCommandFailedException
        Configures the inclusion/exclusion list for this channel which allows specifying specific channel IDs to ignore or include in a search. addIdToInclusionExclusionList(ChannelId, int) is used to configure the IDs in the list.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        listSize - The number of IDs to reference from the id list (starting at index 0). Valid range is 0-4. 0=disable the list.
        exclude - True to ignore the listed devices during a search. False to search for only the listed devices during a search.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • setSearchTimeout

        public void setSearchTimeout(LowPrioritySearchTimeout lowPrioritySearchTimeout)
                      throws RemoteException,
                             AntCommandFailedException
        Configures the length of time that this channel will perform a low priority search. If the low priority search times out, the channel will switch to high priority search mode.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        lowPrioritySearchTimeout - The time before low priority search will timeout in 2.5s units.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • configureFrequencyAgility

        public void configureFrequencyAgility(int freq1,
                             int freq2,
                             int freq3)
                               throws RemoteException,
                                      AntCommandFailedException
        Configures the frequency agility feature for this channel. Should be used in conjunction with the ExtendedAssignment.ExtendedAssignment(boolean, boolean), enableFrequencyAgility parameter in assign(ChannelType, ExtendedAssignment). Should not be used with shared, or Tx-only/Rx-only channel types.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage and AN10 ANT Frequency Agility documents for more details.

        Parameters:
        freq1 - The first operating frequency offset in MHz from 2400MHz (2.4GHz). Valid range is 0-124MHz.
        freq2 - The second operating frequency offset in MHz from 2400MHz (2.4GHz). Valid range is 0-124MHz.
        freq3 - The third operating frequency offset in MHz from 2400MHz (2.4GHz). Valid range is 0-124MHz.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • setProximityThreshold

        public void setProximityThreshold(int searchThreshold)
                           throws RemoteException,
                                  AntCommandFailedException
        Sets a signal strength 'proximity' requirement on finding matches during searching. Note: This value is cleared any time a search is successful.

        Only ANT devices within the set proximity bin can be acquired. Search threshold values are relative to each other only; they are not correlated to specific distances, are not expected to be exactly equivalent between different chips, and will vary depending on the RF environment.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        searchThreshold - The proximity threshold to use. Valid range is 0-10. 0 = disabled. Values are relative to each other only and will vary in different RF environments.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • open

        public void open()
          throws RemoteException,
                 AntCommandFailedException
        Opens this channel. Note: Channel must be in the 'assigned' state first using assign(ChannelType).

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • close

        public void close()
           throws RemoteException,
                  AntCommandFailedException
        Closes this channel.

        Note: This method returns when the close command itself is successful, but not the actual event of the channel completing the close routines. To synchronize on the actual closing of the channel wait for the response event EventCode.CHANNEL_CLOSED in IAntChannelMessageHandler.handleMessage(AntMessageFromAnt).

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

                                        throws RemoteException,

      • setBroadcastData

        public void setBroadcastData(byte[] payload)
                      throws RemoteException
        Sets the broadcast message for this channel. Broadcast messages have no guarantees or status to indicate they have been received by any receivers.

        If this channel is a master it will broadcast this data once every message period. If this channel is a slave it will broadcast this data once at the next transmit window.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        payload - The data to send in the broadcast message. Must be exactly DataMessage.LENGTH_STANDARD_PAYLOAD bytes long.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().

      • sendAcknowledgedData

        public void sendAcknowledgedData(byte[] payload)
                          throws RemoteException,
                                 AntCommandFailedException,
                                 TransferInProgressException
        Sends an acknowledged message on this channel. Acknowledged messages will report if they have been received and acknowledged by a receiver or not through response events in IAntChannelMessageHandler.handleMessage(AntMessageFromAnt)

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        payload - The data to send in the acknowledged message. Must be exactly DataMessage.LENGTH_STANDARD_PAYLOAD bytes long.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".
        TransferInProgressException - If you receive this exception then it means an acknowledged message is already processing on this channel

      • startBurstTransfer

        public void startBurstTransfer(byte[] data)
                        throws RemoteException,
                               AntCommandFailedException,
                               TransferInProgressException
        Transmits the given data on this channel as a series of burst messages. Burst data will report if it has been received and acknowledged by a receiver or not through response events in IAntChannelMessageHandler.handleMessage(AntMessageFromAnt)

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for details.

        Parameters:
        data - The data to send as a burst. Must be at least DataMessage.LENGTH_STANDARD_PAYLOAD bytes long.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".
        TransferInProgressException - If you receive this exception then it means a burst transfer is in progress on any channel on the ANT Adapter (hardware) this channel is using.

      • setTransmitPower

        public void setTransmitPower(int outputPowerLevelSetting)
                      throws RemoteException,
                             AntCommandFailedException
        Sets the transmit power level for this channel. By default all channels are requesting a transmit power of as close to 0dBm as supported (usually setting 3).

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for more details.

        Parameters:
        outputPowerLevelSetting - The transmission power to use. The exact meaning of the value passed here changes between hardware. Setting 0 is the lowest, with each higher setting indicating a higher transmit power.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • setAdapterWideLibConfig

        public void setAdapterWideLibConfig(LibConfig libConfig)
                             throws RemoteException,
                                    AntCommandFailedException
        Requests which extended data to include with data messages.

        The Lib Config setting is adapter wide, so any extended data enabled by at least one channel will be enabled for all channels (including channels acquired by other applications). The extended data is only disabled when every channel on the adapter has cleared their requests for that feature. When first acquired, a channel is not requesting any Lib Config features.

        See the ANT Message Protocol and Usage document for details.

        Parameters:
        libConfig - Indicates extended data requested to be enabled.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        AntCommandFailedException - Any response which was not "No Error".

      • setMessageHandler

        public void setMessageHandler(IAntChannelMessageHandler messageHandler)
                       throws RemoteException
        Sets up the handler to be used for callbacks with this channel object. Callbacks include raw ANT messages associated with this channel (including received data messages) and notifications of the channel dying. Setting a handler clears any handler previously registered. The handler can be cleared by calling clearMessageHandler().
        Parameters:
        messageHandler - The handler to receive the channel callbacks. Handler must be non-null.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().
        See Also:
        clearMessageHandler()

      • clearMessageHandler

        public void clearMessageHandler()
                         throws RemoteException
        Clears the handler registered to this callback through setMessageHandler(IAntChannelMessageHandler) and closes its associated resources.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().

      • getCapabilities

        public Capabilities getCapabilities()
                             throws RemoteException
        Gets the Capabilities of this channel. These are based on the hardware the channel is running on.
        Returns:
        The Capabilities of this channel.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - If you receive this exception then the channel should be considered dead. In this circumstance you can attempt to acquire a replacement channel from AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities). Note: You may or may not also receive a callback to IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath().

      • release

        public void release()
        Does the opposite of AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities) or AntChannelProvider.acquireChannel(Context, PredefinedNetwork, Capabilities, Capabilities) by tearing down this channel instance, so it cannot be used after calling this method. This signals the ANT Radio service to reclaim the channel resources for other applications to use. Note: This function will trigger a call on the IAntChannelMessageHandler.onChannelDeath() but that can be avoided by calling clearMessageHandler() first if desired.

      • describeContents

        public int describeContents()

      • writeToParcel

        public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest,
                 int flags)
